intro: Tylophora cirrosa, commonly known as the creeping tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential in treating neurological disorders. Tylophora cirrosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
